summary: the impact of pathogens on exacerbation severity and treatment response remains unclear. our aim was to describe the prevalence of respiratory pathogens in children presenting to the emergency department. the presence of any pathogen (RD 8.2%; 95% CI 3.3%; 13.1%) and non-HRV infection as a group were positively associated with treatment failure. the presence of any pathogen (RD 8.2%; 95% CI 3.3%; 13.1%) and of INF and PIV specifically were positively associated with treatment failure.
